description: CRITICAL: Domain concepts must use domain-specific language, not generic terms. Objects should expose properties representing what they contain (e.g., recommended_trades), not methods that 'generate' or 'calculate' things. If field-level variables are needed for clarity, show them with dot notation (class.field).

content: Use domain-specific terms for classes, responsibilities, and collaborators
Properties represent what objects contain (Get recommended trades)
Use dot notation for field-level variables (class.field)

dont.description: Don't use generic terms or generate/calculate methods
content: Don't use generic terms like 'parameter', 'result', 'data', 'config' without domain context
Don't use method names like 'generate' or 'calculate' when a property would better represent the domain concept
- Responsibilities starting with 'Generate', 'Calculate' when property would be better
- Collaborators that are generic types without domain meaning
